properties.areaDesc: South Central Elko County; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; White Pine County; Northeastern Nye County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; Northwestern Nye County; Southeastern Elko County
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 31 at 3:05PM PST until February 3 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Elko NV
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected with the passage of a strong cold front on
Sunday afternoon and evening. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4
inches expected in valleys with 6 to locally up to 12 inches
possible in the mountains of eastern White Pine County. Wind
gusts of 40 up to 55 mph possible along and especially behind
the front Sunday night.

* WHERE...Portions of north central, northeast and south central
Nevada.

* WHEN...From 4 PM Sunday to 4 AM PST Monday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A band of heavier Snow showers and gusty
winds will accompany the passage of a strong cold front which
could produce one to four inches of snowfall along with blowing
snow and intervals of reduced visibility. Slippery road
conditions are expected to develop Sunday evening as
temperatures fall below freezing.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Weather Advisory snow means adverse winter conditions
will impact road and air travel. Expect limited visibilities at
times with roads becoming snow covered and slippery, especially
in higher elevation summit and pass areas.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM SUNDAY TO 4 AM PST MONDAY
